programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Qui√±ones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Going West
programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

programme.title: Chicago Needs a PLL Team | All-Access Vlog
programme.desc: RJ takes you behind the scenes of the jam packed Chicago PLL weekend in an all-access video.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season ‚Äì she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer ‚Äì While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season ‚Äì she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer ‚Äì While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. programme.title: How the West Was Won
programme.desc: Setting off on a journey to the west in the 1830s, the Prescott family run into a man named Linus (James Stewart), who helps them fight off a pack of thieves. Linus then marries daughter Eve Prescott (Carroll Baker), and 30 years later goes off to fight in the Civil War with their son, with bloody results. Eve's sister, Lily (Debbie Reynolds), heads further west and has adventures with a professional gambler (Gregory Peck), stretching all the way to San Francisco and into the 1880s.

programme.title: Great Day in the Morning
programme.desc: In Denver before the outbreak of the Civil War, North Carolina native Owen Pentecost (Robert Stack) tricks saloon owner Jumbo Means (Raymond Burr) into losing everything he owns -- including some valuable mining claims -- in a card game. As headstrong dressmaker Ann (Virginia Mayo) and bartender Boston (Ruth Roman) spar over Owen's affections, his fellow Southerners begin assembling their gold to fund the Confederate Army, as the town's Northerners form their own militia and prepare for war.

programme.title: War Paint
programme.desc: With only nine days to deliver a peace treaty to the chief of a strong Native American tribe, Lt. Billings (Robert Stack) and his troopers are in a race against time to avoid all-out war. Since time is of the essence, Billings recruits the chief's son, Taslik (Keith Larsen), to guide the men to the village. However, Billings and his men are unaware that a group of renegades, wary of the suspicious U.S. treaty, seek to kill the messengers before they can complete their mission.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A gang of hired killers rides into Diablo. Lofty believes that they're in town to murder a state senator with powerful enemies in the capitol. When Lofty discovers that the gang's leader...

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: During a heated election campaign between honest lawyer Dave Morgan and Carter Holmes, a crooked politician, the contest takes a violent turn.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Lofty and Annie become concerned when homesteaders are forced to sell their spreads cheaply because of rustlers, poisoned waterholes and cut fences.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Tagg Oakley is tricked into driving a wagon full of gunpowder to Fort Yuma not realizing that Geronimo and his Apache braves have been tipped to the time and route of the delivery.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A old female peddler is injured when her team of horses bolts. While she recuperates under Lofty's care, Annie writes to her estranged son in Texas and asks him to visit his ailing parent.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Miners resent the Bella Union Hotel for catering to the upper crust.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets tipped off about gang that's shanghaiing sailors.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt faces a court battle when he tries to have a man convicted on circumstantial evidence.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets involved with a conniving female while trailing an outlaw.

programme.title: Fort Massacre
programme.desc: After his cavalry company is decimated by an Apache attack, Vinson (Joel McCrea) takes charge and tries to lead his remaining men to safety. Unfortunately, his pathological hatred of Native Americans causes him to commit rash acts that put his troops in jeopardy. The enlisted men, especially the rebellious McGurney (Forrest Tucker), question Vinson's leadership and even his morality, but the soldiers must stick together if they wish to make it through Apache lands.

programme.title: Wichita
programme.desc: After a group of drunken trail riders runs amok, Mayor Andrew Hope (Carl Benton Reid) of Wichita, Kan., recruits the intrepid Wyatt Earp (Joel McCrea) to end lawlessness. Armed and ready for anything, the new marshal decides he will end gun violence simply by banning guns. Soon Earp must face crooked rancher Clint Wallace (Walter Sande) and whiskey slinger Doc Black (Edgar Buchanan), vicious locals who like Wichita exactly as it is and don't take kindly to being told what to do.

programme.title: Gunsight Ridge
programme.desc: Gunslinger Mike Ryan (Joel McCrea) is intent on bringing the dangerous outlaw Velvet Clark (Mark Stevens) to justice. However, Ryan is at a disadvantage, since he doesn't know what the masked robber looks like. Ryan begins to work with the area sheriff and falls for the lawman's pretty daughter, Molly Jones (Joan Weldon). With Clark hiding in plain sight as a piano player, the criminal manages to evade Ryan for a while, but eventually the two adversaries come face-to-face.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A condemned killer being transported by train murders a marshal and takes Mark hostage.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Gunfight at Dodge City
programme.desc: Gambler and gunman Bat Masterson (Joel McCrea) rides into Dodge City, Kan., to visit his straight-arrow brother, Ed (Harry Lauter), who is hoping to defeat crooked sheriff Jim Regan (Don Haggerty) in an upcoming election. Bat purchases and renovates a rundown saloon, attracting the notice of Regan's henchmen. A shooting during the saloon's opening-night celebration causes Bat to pursue his own political vendetta against Regan and attempt to clean up the town's corruption once and for all.

programme.title: The Outriders
programme.desc: Three Confederate soldiers escape from Union captivity, only to be captured by bandit Keeley -- then spared when he discovers they're fellow Southerners. Keeley forces them to help with his next planned heist: stealing gold from a wagon train led by Don Antonio Chaves. The men insinuate themselves with Chaves in preparation for the robbery, but when Will (Joel McCrea) falls in love with a widow (Arlene Dahl) traveling with Chaves, the three men must decide whether to continue the plan.

programme.title: Colorado Territory
programme.desc: Outlaw Wes McQueen (Joel McCrea) escapes from jail and travels to a meeting with his old partner-in-crime Dave Rickard (Basil Ruysdael). En route, McQueen dispatches a gang of bandits who try to rob the stagecoach and, in the process, wins the attentions of a young woman (Dorothy Malone) with whom he'd like to settle down. Convinced by Rickard to do one last heist, he finds out that his fellow henchmen are not to be trusted and the woman he truly loves is an ex-saloon girl (Virginia Mayo).

programme.title: Man From God's Country
programme.desc: A former sheriff (George Montgomery) drifts to another town and helps a Civil War buddy clean it up.

programme.title: The Hills Run Red
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Jerry Brewster (Thomas Hunter) and Ken Seagull (Nando Gazzolo) steal a fortune from the U.S. Army. But, when the partners in crime are ambushed by Union troops, they have to split up; Seagall escapes with the money, and Brewster gets a five-year jail sentence. When Brewster gets out, he discovers that his old crony is responsible for the death of his beloved wife. With the help of a gunslinger named Getz (Dan Duryea), Brewster embarks on a quest for vengeance.

programme.title: Best of the Badmen
programme.desc: After the North defeats the South, Union Maj. Jeff Clanton (Robert Ryan) heads to Missouri to provide the Confederacy's Quantrill's Raiders a chance to claim allegiance to the Union, thereby clearing their wanted status. But standing in Clanton's way are the corrupt lawmen Joad (Barton MacLane) and Fowler (Robert Preston), who would rather keep the men outlaws to collect the reward on their heads. After Joad and Fowler frame Clanton for murder, he manages to escape, becoming an outlaw himself.

programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Baby Boomer
programme.desc: Veteran funny man Louie Anderson returns to the stage in this hilarious one hour stand up comedy special. Louie takes an unconventional and jovial look at his bad habits, pesky family members, and aging body.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Underwear
programme.desc: The iconic comic plays on the challenges of getting healthy, life on the road, dealing with technology and how we all eventually become our parents.

programme.title: Michael Gelbart: All New Smash Hits
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Michael Gelbart's profanity-free, yet adult set, for audiences takes on love, relationships, and where the world is now.

programme.title: Mike E. Winfield: StepMan
programme.desc: The comedian stars in his own one-man show about marrying an older woman and finding out how much he is truly similar to his younger stepson.

programme.title: Paul Rodriguez: The Here and Wow
programme.desc: Veteran comedian, Paul Rodriguez hits the stage to give his perspectives on life, from being peer pressured into believing in God to claiming to be the village idiot.

programme.title: Rhys Darby: Mystic Time Bird
programme.desc: The Flight of the Conchords star known for his silly perspectives, physicality, and sound effects, discusses mysticism, past lives, and birds.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Takin' It To D.C.
programme.desc: Whether he's talking about sex, the national anthem, cockroaches or impersonating Michael Jackson, the triple threat is sure to make you laugh.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Illin' In Philly
programme.desc: This is Tommy Davidson, from "In Living Color", at his funniest! Check out this classic stand-up special and remember the 90s!

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Wendy Liebman: It‚Äôs Wendy
programme.desc: Wendy Liebman delivers 45 minutes of pure gold, discussing things like pen pals, the magic of tidying up your space, and her goofy dogs.

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli: Finding the Funny
programme.desc: The hilarious and sometimes humiliating aspects of domestic life, including marriage and in-laws, are the focus of this comedy special.

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli's Way After School Special
programme.desc: The comic tells it like it is on stage at her old high school, where the former captain of the cheerleaders shows off her witty takes on the world.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford I Could Eat Part 2
programme.desc: Meat's on the menu with Lavell Crawford keeping Burger King humble to their have it your way slogan, godless vegetarians, and why the best chicken is from a house of God.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: New Look Same Funny! (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford, with a new look and new outlook on life, hosts a new standup special.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
programme.desc: The excitable comic again proves why he is one of the world‚Äôs premiere funnymen, ripping into racial stereotypes, Viagra, the First Lady, and more.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable

programme.title: Bob Saget: That‚Äôs What I‚Äôm Talkin‚Äô About

programme.title: Bob Saget: Zero to Sixty
programme.desc: The popular stand-up declares himself to be the last TV father viewers can trust, as he shares funny words of wisdom and new, original comedy so

programme.title: David Cross: Oh, Come On

programme.desc: Gallagher performs his ever-famous zany antics in Texas. Complete with a magical blimp ride over the rainbow, Gallagher takes you on an intelligent and wacky journey. Take a trip to the insane with Gallagher in a sea of laughter and Sledge-O-Matic goo!

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests apples, pears and quince and plants indoor bulbs, we meet a Northern Irish daffodil breeder, and Carol Klein travels to Wales to explore the Eupatorium with a passionate gardener who has a rare and spectacular collection.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives more advice on tomato-growing, Nick Bailey travels to South Africa in search of the cousins of the Crocosmia, and Advolly Richmond looks at the Victorian trend of garden theme parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team are at RHS Rosemoor in Devon to find out about their fruit trees and sedum collection, and Joe visits Scampston Hall, home of a ten-year experiment in naturalistic planting by garden designer Piet Oudolf.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty undertakes more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Arit Anderson meets a garden designer in Somerset who has worked in harmony with nature to create a garden on a former brownfield site.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, catching viewers up on his new patio project and discussing his plans for the autumn. Arit Anderson travels to Somerset to meet landscape designer Dan Pearson, to find out about the design and planting principles he has used to create his own garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween approaching, Monty takes stock of his pumpkins and squashes, plants up alpines and shows how to divide a large fern to create new plants. Meanwhile, Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to stake dahlias, sows seeds of perennials and celebrates an abundant vegetable harvest. The team meet a landscape designer in Cornwall who creates gardens that are not only sustainable but also beautiful and edible.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the roses in his garden, harvests honey from his bees and gives advice on the maintenance of hardy geraniums as well as planting others for summer groundcover. Rachel de Thame shows how the most ordinary of spaces can be transformed by adding seasonal containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.desc: Steve Rimmer, the owner of DirtFish, shows Chris his impressive rally car collection.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa
programme.desc: The new 911 GT3 is the most important Porsche of all | Revelations with Jason Cammisa

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Thailand's JDM Disneyland Built Inside a Mini Mall and a 1600HP GT-R

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - '32 Ford and Volvo Amazon
programme.desc: Chip Foose sits down to draw and share his thoughts on how the 1932 Ford Model B design is still relevant today.Next, Chip tweaks the design of a lesser-known European classic: the Volvo Amazon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews and drives the Maserati GT2 Stradale and also drives the last Bora, the mid-engined Maserati road car.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Massive stash of cars in old car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a tour of an enormous "museum" of forgotten cars stashed in a defunct car dealership. Tom's next stop reveals a rare Corvair, a large collection of Mazdas, and a rare "Alfa Jr."

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1969 COPO Camaro, 1969 Mustang Mach 1, and a 1969 Z/28 Camaro RS
programme.desc: Colin Comer starts this episode out with an original 1969 double COPO Camaro before moving onto a well-driven and well-loved 1969 Ford Mustang Mach 1. To wrap things up, Colin appraises a well-documented 1969 Chevy Camaro Z/28 "DZ-code."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn find road trip in a restored Ford Country Squire wagon
programme.desc: After attempting to buff out a dusty fender on a junkyard Ford, Tom Cotter is inspired to clean up the whole car, get it running, and take it on a road trip from Texas to Kansas and find more barn finds along the way!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A band of Broncos hidden in the Alaskan bush
programme.desc: A band of Broncos hidden in the Alaskan bush

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Sitting for 40 years: Resurrecting a 1951 Nash Deliveryman
programme.desc: Sitting for 40 years: Resurrecting a 1951 Nash Deliveryman.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1066 Mile Buick GNX & "Natural" Wide-body Camaro RS
programme.desc: Tom visits two friends to see and hear about two special cars.

programme.title: Corky Coker's Honest Charley Garage
programme.desc: Corky takes the 1936 Yellowstone Bus out for us! Casey gives an overview of the new dash in the Jaguar restoration project and then we get to see the new replica Marmon Wasp built at Honest Charley Garage.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | AMC Rebel Machine, Triumph Stag, and a Porsche race car
programme.desc: AMC Rebel Machine, Triumph Stag, and a Porsche race car

programme.title: Driveway Finds
programme.desc: Dustin and Brito attempt to revive an old Pontiac Firebird.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | A band of Broncos hidden in the Alaskan bush
programme.desc: A band of Broncos hidden in the Alaskan bush

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That‚Äôs where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4‚Äîand where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT‚Äôs first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way‚Äîwith stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It‚Äôs all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT‚Äôs past adventures.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana‚Äôs only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That‚Äôs where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4‚Äîand where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients‚Äîfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan‚Äôs kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT‚Äôs first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way‚Äîwith stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It‚Äôs all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT‚Äôs past adventures.

Season 12 of Team200 launches this week, and we‚Äôre kicking things off with a thrilling recap of last year‚Äôs unforgettable moments! Massive elk roaming the rugged landscapes of New Mexico, colossal bruins prowling the wilds of Northern Canada, and jaw-dropping from the Midwest‚Äîincluding a couple 200-inch bucks! You won‚Äôt want to miss a single episode of this season‚Äôs heart-pounding adventures!

This week, we trail Adam Hays and Kris Seymour into the wilds of New Mexico, where they pursue giant bull elk. Adam embarks on a DIY hunt on a new ranch while Kris, perched high in his Lone Wolf tree stand, sets his sights on a massive bull at his favorite watering hole.
Shan Twit, the newest member of Team200, chases some big whitetails in his home state of Kentucky!

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: A darkly humorous, edgy tale of a lady gunslinger, who rides into a lawless frontier town to compete in a quick-draw contest and settle an old score.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: You Can't Run Away From It
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress teams up with an enterprising reporter to escape her domineering father's plan of keeping her from getting married.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father‚Äôs yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: 711 Ocean Drive
programme.desc: A phone company repairman bites off more than he can chew when he agrees to create a system that broadcasts race track results for a crime boss.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (V√≠ctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an expos√© of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fianc√©e (Luz M√°rquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) and Cannonball (Dub Taylor) save Lodestone from swindlers preparing a bond scam.

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Kings Row
programme.desc: Small town scandals inspire an idealistic young man to take up psychiatry.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: Tom Thumb
programme.desc: A six-inch-tall boy takes on a pair of comical crooks.

programme.title: The Falcon's Brother
programme.desc: When a debonair P.I. with a crime-fighting alter ego is shot, his brother assumes the disguise in a case involving Nazi espionage and assassination.

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Abbott and Costello are on an island with deadly pirates.

programme.title: Sergeant York
programme.desc: Recruited to fight in World War I, a Tennessee farmer with deep pacifist beliefs is driven to take up arms when his unit is overwhelmed by Germans.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies
programme.desc: A family relocates from the city to the suburbs. Challenges ensue when a damaging play review leads a famed actress to target the husband.

programme.title: The Valley of Decision
programme.desc: A housemaid's romance is complicated by labor disputes in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate
programme.desc: A pirate gets mixed up in a Caribbean revolution.

programme.title: Dodge City
programme.desc: Because someone‚Äôs gotta do it, a Texas cattleman takes on the task of cleaning up the wild and lawless Dodge City while courting one of its women.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: The Roaring Twenties
programme.desc: Three friends return from World War I to the United States in the era of jazz, speakeasies and bootleggers.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: The Last Run (1971)
programme.desc: A retired Chicago getaway driver living in Portugal decides to come out of retirement for one last run.

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Thieves plot to rob the Los Angeles Coliseum box office during a Rams game.

programme.title: Yolanda and the Thief
programme.desc: A con man poses as a Latin American heiress' guardian angel.

programme.title: Footlight Parade
programme.desc: A Broadway producer is forced to learn how to make a living in film.

programme.title: An American in Paris
programme.desc: Gene Kelly sings and dances his way through Paris as a WWII veteran.

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: A swinging bachelor finds love when he meets a girl immune to his line.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Never Let Me Go (1953)
programme.desc: An American hatches a dangerous plan to smuggle his wife out of Russia.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: A bride attempts to turn her six brothers-in-law into gentlemen.

programme.title: David Copperfield (1935)
programme.desc: Charles Dickens' classic tale of an orphaned boy's fight for happiness.

programme.desc: A professor from Lewis' past tips off the BAU to an alarming number of overdose deaths of patients who just completed rehab.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The man who murdered McGarrett's father resurfaces; Chin Ho's life is put in danger during a hostage situation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: After coming across a rare historical artifact, Shelby forms an unlikely alliance with Professor Sam Hyde of Southeastern Louisiana University and the two scour the deepest parts of the Swamp on the search for lost treasures.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard takes on the toughest challenge of his career; Papac Alaska goes to a remote, mountainous island to tackle the biggest job in the company's history; Greg Chapman starts on a quest to find a lost logging train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard crew batles Mother Nature as temperatures climb; Joe is still reeling from his injury; Greg Chapman pulls an extremely rare double barrel log from the St John's River.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe has to call upon his son Aidan to step up and fill the family shoes; an overcrowded landing means one wrong move could wipe out the Papac crew below; Greg's quest to find the Lost Log Train is back on track.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, production's rising with the newest generation of Rygaard on the job; David Zitterkopf is back in action with his son Levi to take on their biggest; Papac's new unit puts the crew to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaard crew gets a surprise visit from logging legend Craig Rygaard; the Zitterkopfs face a major obstacle in their push to complete their largest ever job; Papac battles the Longest Yard unit with its mile long skyline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging is trying to get back on track with the help of patriarch Craig Rygaard; the Swampman's under the gun to build an emergency treetop storm shelter; David Zitterkopf's son Levi gets a crucial lesson in logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard pushes his crew to a breaking point; Gary and Eddie blow up their business to cash in on green gold; David Zitterkopf could see his family empire fall to pieces, with one wrong move; a mutiny is underway among the Chapman crew.

programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fianc√© Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog juggles his job and family responsibilities at the same time. He leads the search for Robert, a low-level drug dealer who makes money by selling hedge clippings as marijuana and broken Macadamia nuts as crack.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after a fugitive named Tracy who lives in a homeless shelter, but the shelter's staff is uncooperative, and the two sides get into an angry confrontation that forces Dog to temporarily back off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the posse are off to the Big Island for their wedding. They hope to relax for a few days and take care of final details but it turns out Leland has a fugitive he needs to capture.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is busy. First he's after a fugitive who is allegedly an expert in the game of "burn and return"--shoplifting goods to return them for cash refunds. But he's not easy to track.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting and it is through this maze of illusions that Dog pursues his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy and today he's proving it. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out.
